intro: Sisymbrium erysimifolium, commonly known as the yellow rocket, is an annual plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops such as cabbage and mustard. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring basal leaves that are lance-shaped and yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its seeds are small, elongated, and often have a pungent odor due to the presence of glucosinolates. Sisymbrium erysimifolium is often found in disturbed soils and can be considered a weed in agricultural settings.
